description: Borrowed from French bandeau, from Old French bandel, diminutive form of bande. Doublet of bendel.

examples: She wore a bandeau in her hair.
The frontal bandeau is then elevated en bloc. A Bi on BC1 (Midas Rex) bit is used to create the osteotomies circumferentially.

entries.meaning: A narrow, tight bra, especially when strapless; hence, any women's top made from a similar band of fabric.
examples: At Paris fashion week, a few weeks later, Kim’s sister Kendall wore a minimalist black bandeau top that echoed Kim’s look.
